name: Greek Roasted Pork Chops
description: This low-carb, nutritious, tasty meal is an easy pleaser. You can marinate chops in the fridge up to 6 hours ahead, or freeze a double batch for an easy meal next week.
preparation: Place chops and 1⁄2 cup Greek Dressing in a sealable freezer bag. Turn several times to coat chops evenly.

Discard marinade, and place chops on a Sheet Pan lined with a Sheet Pan Liner. Roast until cooked through, approximately 10–15 minutes. Alternatively, grill chops over medium-high heat, turning once, for approximately 8–10 minutes. Brush with remaining Greek Dressing during last 2 minutes of cooking.
Let chops rest for 5 minutes before serving.
tips: For a quick, mess-free chop dinner in minutes, microwave boneless marinated chops in a Multipurpose Steamer on medium for 5–7 minutes.

products.name: Greek Dressing Mix
summary: Herbs make salad dressings taste great, but they can be a pain to buy and use while fresh. Enter our Greek Dressing to solve the problem. Packed with only good food ingredients, including garlic, oregano, mint, and zero additives, it’s easy to make your own healthy dressing with this simple blend. Just mix it with olive oil and red wine vinegar and give it a shake. Add crumbled feta or Greek yogurt for a creamier dressing.

products.name: Sheet Pan
summary: Lightweight all-purpose baking sheet made from a single piece of aluminum, with a one-inch rim.

products.name: Sheet Pan Liner
summary: Nonstick silicone baking sheet. Ideal for baking, roasting, sheet pan meals & more!

products.name: Multipurpose Steamer
summary: Like a casserole dish in design & purpose, this cooking utensil is made of silicone & has a 14-cup capacity.
